unittitle.value: Richard M. Pieronek photographic slides of New York City

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: Richard M. Pieronek (1926-2002) was a photographer based in Hamtramck, Michigan. The collection includes about 1200 color photographic slides taken by Pieronek in New York City at various times from the 1950s to the 1970s. Principal subjects include the July 1976 U.S. bicentennial celebrations and the 1964 World's Fair. There are also images of ships, buildings, street scenes, Times Square, Greenwich Village, San Gennaro Festival, the Statue of Liberty, and other subjects.

p.value: This collection should be cited as the Richard M. Pieronek photographic slides of New York City, PR 327, Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections, New-York Historical Society.
Gift of Richard Pieronek's daughter, Patty Pieronek Frost, 2017.

(The above note is based principally on Pieronek's obituary in the on-line version of the 
                <emph render="italic">Grosse Point News</emph> of 29 November 2002 and the donor's covering letter of 13 March 2017 with the gift.)

The collection includes about 1200 color slide transparencies of New York City scenes taken by photographer Dick Pieronek. Almost half of the collection includes scenes from the U.S. bicentennial celebrations in July 1976, including the tall ships in New York Harbor, naval parades, and the visit of England's Queen Elizabeth. Another sizable set includes images from the 1964 World's Fair in Flushing, Queens. Other slides, dating from the 1950s-1960s, depict buildings, street scenes, the Statue of Liberty, Times Square, Broadway (including photos of scenes from plays taken from a distance in the audience), Greenwich Village, the San Gennaro Festival, ships at the city docks, and other subject matter. Some slides are "aerial" views taken from the observatory roof of the World Trade Center in 1976 and the RCA Building in 1962. The collection includes a cd of the slides.

corpname.value: New York World’s Fair (1964-1965 : New York, N.Y.). -- Photographs

dsc.value:
Slide Case 1 1 1 1950s Scope and Contents Note

Includes various New York City scenes from the 1950s, including ships, tugboats, piers, harbor, Statue of Liberty, Broadway and scenes from plays (Happy Hunting, Boy Friend, My Fair Lady, Lil Abner), Rockettes, Times Square, subway platforms, and various buildings and street scenes.

 Slide Case 2 1 2 1962 Scope and Contents Note

Includes New York City scenes from 1962 including Lincoln Center, Greenwich Village, Greenwich Nursery, skyline from RCA Building, ships (Queen Mary, Constitution, Spanish sailing vessel, others).

 Slide Case 3 1 3 1963-1964 Scope and Contents Note

Includes Prometheus at Rockefeller Center (1963), street scenes, and San Gennaro Festival.

 Slide Case 4. World's Fair 1 4 1964 Slide Case 5 2 5 1964-1965, 1969 Scope and Contents Note

Includes ship RMS Queen Elizabeth and New York Harbor (September 1964), Herald Square statue (1965), and street scenes, buildings, etc. (1969).

 Slide Cases 6, 7, 8 2 6-8 1976 July Scope and Contents Note

Includes street scenes and buildings, World Trade Center (including views at and from the roof observatory) and bicentennial event celebrations, including the tall ships parade, naval personnel and ships parade, Queen Elizabeth parade, and ships, including the Queen Elizabeth 2 (QE2).

 CD of Slides 1 1 1950s-1976 Scope and Contents Note

The CD is labeled as "Courtesy of Pieronek Studios, Detroit, Michigan."
